articles.title: How Egypt is trying to encourage the return of tourism
articles.description: Egypt is reopening its borders to international tourists on 1 July,but many parts of the country will remain off-limits.

articles.title: Where to find the best scuba diving sites
articles.description: With a dazzling bounty of underwater attractions to explore and improved access to key diving hubs, there has arguably never been a better time to strap…

articles.title: Four of the best day trips from Cairo
articles.description: While Egypt’s ancient capital has more than enough dusty charms to fill a traveller’s playbook, the country’s top natural sites stretch far out from Cairo…

articles.title: Hot Air Ballooning in Luxor
articles.description: It’s an incredibly peaceful time in the air. The balloon is literally floating, you don’t feel a thing, and it’s so silent. All the while you fly over one of the most amazing sceneries worldwide.

articles.title: Al-Qataneyah Dunes for Sandboarding & Barbecuing
articles.description: It’s the best getaway from trafficy noisy Cairo, located 80km southwest of the city so in less than an hour you can enjoy the emptiness of the desert

articles.title: Cleopatra’s Bath in Siwa
articles.description: Located in Siwa Oasis, and is one of its landmarks. It’s basically a pool that is fed with water from natural hot springs, it’s the best way to cool off the heat of a hot summer day.
